title: NASA assigns two astronauts to Starliner test flight
summary: NASA has assigned two veteran astronauts to the first crewed flight of Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner spacecraft in the latest reshuffling of personnel assigned to the long-delayed mission.

title: Senate Armed Services Committee proposes DoD funding boost for 2023
summary: The Senate Armed Services Committee on June 16 voted 23-3 to advance its version of the 2023 National Defense Authorization Act.

title: Europe’s major new rocket, the Ariane 6, is delayed again
summary: "This is a source of challenge in every launcher development."

title: NASA Updates Astronaut Assignments for Boeing Starliner Test Flight
summary: NASA will fly two astronaut test pilots aboard the agency’s Boeing Crew Flight Test (CFT) mission to the International Space Station, where they will live and work off the Earth for about two weeks.

title: Quadsat gets ESA funding for ready-to-fly antenna testing kits
summary: Danish startup Quadsat said June 16 it has secured European Space Agency funding to productize the drones it uses to calibrate and test satellite antennas.

title: Euroconsult anticipates growing demand for last-mile logistics
summary: Euroconsult forecasts 120 orbital transport vehicles to be in operation by 2031, according to the consulting firm’s latest Space Logistics Markets report.

title: SpaceX planning another trifecta of launches this weekend
summary: SpaceX teams in Florida and California are preparing for three missions from three launch pads in three days, beginning Friday with a launch from the Kennedy Space Center in Florida with a reusable Falcon 9 booster flying for a record 13th time.

title: Firefly co-founder Markusic to step down as CEO
summary: Firefly Aerospace announced June 15 that Tom Markusic, co-founder of the launch vehicle and spacecraft developer, will step down as its chief executive but remain with the company as it prepares for its second launch.

title: D-Orbit charts ambitious course for space logistics business
summary: D-Orbit has ambitious plans to offer a wide variety of satellite services from active debris removal to space-based cloud computing.

title: Fourth SLS countdown test set for June 20
summary: NASA is gearing up for a fourth attempt to perform a fueling test and practice countdown of its Space Launch System ahead of a launch now no earlier than the latter half of August.
